t: Job 4
Eliphaz Speaks: The Innocent Prosper
Then*p Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:
“If*pn one ventures a word with you, will you be impatient? Yet*ld who can keep from speaking?
Behold,*ln you have instructed many, and*ld you have strengthened the weak hands.
Your*ln words have upheld him who was stumbling, and*ld you have made firm the feeble knees.
But*ln now it has come to you, and you are impatient; it*ld touches you, and you are dismayed.
Is*ln not your fear of God your confidence, and*ld the integrity of your ways your hope?
“Remember:*pn who that was innocent ever perished? Or*ld where were the upright cut off?
As*ln I have seen, those who plow iniquity and*ld sow trouble reap the same.
By*ln the breath of God they perish, and*ld by the blast of his anger they are consumed.
The*ln roar of the lion, the voice of the fierce lion, the*ld teeth of the young lions are broken.
The*ln strong lion perishes for lack of prey, and*ld the cubs of the lioness are scattered.
“Now*pn a word was brought to me stealthily; my*ld ear received the whisper of it.
Amid*ln thoughts from visions of the night, when*ld deep sleep falls on men,
dread*ln came upon me, and trembling, which*ld made all my bones shake.
A*ln spirit glided past my face; the*ld hair of my flesh stood up.
It*ln stood still, but*ld I could not discern its appearance. A*ln form was before my eyes; there*ld was silence, then I heard a voice:
‘Can*ln mortal man be in the right before God? Can*ld a man be pure before his Maker?
Even*ln in his servants he puts no trust, and*ld his angels he charges with error;
how*ln much more those who dwell in houses of clay, whose*ld foundation is in the dust, who*ld are crushed like the moth.
Between*ln morning and evening they are beaten to pieces; they*ld perish forever without anyone regarding it.
Is*ln not their tent-cord plucked up within them, do*ld they not die, and that without wisdom?’
